summary:
Writing the story of The Ocean Cleanup - ridding the world’s oceans of plastic, one word at a time.

Summarised: law graduate to English teacher in Czech Republic and Switzerland to legal editor with two major corporate law firms in Amsterdam to...see above.

Not that I'm counting, but words used (to various degrees) by BBC, CNN, ABC, Reuters, The New York Times, The Independent (UK), MailOnline (I know), the LA Times, and lots of Guatemalan, Jamaican, Indonesian, Malaysian and Dominican news agencies and networks that I unfortunately can't quite remember.

profile_positions.description:
theoceancleanup.com

If it's long, I probably wrote it. If it's short, I probably advised the person who wrote it. If there's a typo, I was probably off that day. 



- Editor-in-chief and lead writer for all written communications on The Ocean Cleanup's website, blog posts, updates and scientific publications.

- Developing the language and tone of voice throughout The Ocean Cleanup to tell our story in an engaging and transparent way to donors, scientific collaborators, governments, institutional partners and millions of supporters.

- As part of an industry-leading Communications team, forming transparent and engaging storylines to communicate successes (and failures) in our mission to rid the oceans of plastic, including the Tsunami of Trash campaign in Guatemala with total global reach of 1.3bn.

- Close collaboration with CEO Boyan Slat for his Guest Essay in The New York Times Opinion: https://www.nytimes.com/2023/05/25/opinion/river-plastic-ocean.html

- Drafting and editing speeches and other content for important milestones and updates, including for the CEO and other senior crew.

- Supporting the PR & Media Manager with official statements, press releases, Q&As and article proposals for media, spokespersons and our supporters.

- Aiding with pitching and ensuring consistency in public messaging with corporate and philanthropic partners such as The Coca-Cola Company, Kia, the Grace Kennedy Foundation, the #TeamSeas campaign (with MrBeast and Mark Rober) and other confidential prospects.

- Managing mandatory reporting for the Foundation and writing major funder updates, including for UHNWIs and global institutions.

- Assisting Global Affairs team with submissions for governments and major international organizations (govt ministries of the Netherlands, Indonesia and Guatemala, UNDP, UNEP etc.) and events, including written submissions to the 2022 United Nations Oceans Conference and CEO briefing for a live interview at the 2023 UN Water Conference.

profile_positions.description:
As part of the Knowledge Management and Innovation team, sole editor in firm of over 500 employees with many English-speaking clients. 

Responsible for editing high-level legal documents for global, world-leading corporate clients across industries including energy, tech and telecommunications. Editing assignments include highly privileged client memoranda, SPAs, deeds of transfer, and submissions prepared by Stibbe lawyers for institutions including the Dutch Supreme Court, the European Commission, the European Court of Justice and international arbitration bodies. 

Other duties include coaching lawyers (including partners) for English-language presentations and conferences with client executives and legal counsel, bi-yearly writing workshops for junior associates, voiceovers for internal videos and guides and a monthly presentation to newly-hired employees. 

Also advising on website and legal template revisions and updates, providing input into strategy for introduction and implementation of new language technologies such as software translation and template automation, and ensuring seamless service to lawyers during the corona-enforced working from home.
profile_positions.title: Legal Editor

profile_positions.description:
Within the Communications team in the Business Development department, responsibilities include editing legal and non-legal texts including contract templates, press releases both for De Brauw and for our clients, confidential client documents, internal and external communications (including for HR, Training, Finance, Events and Clients Relationships), internet and intranet posts and articles, as well as frequently contributing suggestions and copywriting contributions to all of these. Ensuring perfect accuracy in the English language and applying De Brauw house style to ensure firm-wide consistency in tone of voice, terminology and accessibility, while also having enough variation to offer different styles of communication in diverse situations and for a variety of purposes.

Also involved in coordinating with colleagues (including partners, lawyers, and colleagues such as graphic designers and communications officers) to assist with management of large projects, distribution of resources and ensuring editing and proof-reading assignments are completed according to clients' timetables.

Also creating and delivering English language courses focused on specific needs (Legal English, English for secretarial purposes, public speaking etc), occasional voiceover work for internal videos or guides, a monthly presentation to newly-hired employees on internal house style, and coordinating the editing, design and distribution of our monthly legal journal 'In Context' to over 7000 recipients (including examination of analytics to refine style and delivery methods). In Context can be found here https://www.debrauw.com/news/newsletters/.

I also worked pro bono with a group of Syrian lawyers recently relocated to the Netherlands, and designed and taught a Legal English course to allow them to better continue their work in Europe.
